slokas: अर्जुन उवाचकिं तद्‌ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम ।अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: What is that Brahman? What is the self? What is action, O Supreme Person? What is said to be the material manifestation, and what is called the divine?

slokas: अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन ।प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Who is the Adhiyajna here in this body, O Madhusudana? And how are you to be known at the time of death by the self-controlled?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते ।भूतभावोद्भ‍वकरो विसर्ग: कर्मसंज्ञित: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: The imperishable is the Supreme Brahman; one's own nature is called the Self. The act of offering which causes the origin of beings is called action.

slokas: अधिभूतं क्षरो भाव: पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् ।अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: The physical manifestation is the perishable nature, and the person is the presiding deity. I alone am the lord of sacrifice here in the body, O best among the embodied.

slokas: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् ।य: प्रयाति स मद्भ‍ावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशय: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: At the time of death, whoever remembers Me and leaves the body, he attains My being; of this there is no doubt.

slokas: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भ‍ावभावित: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Whatever state of being one remembers when he gives up the body at the end, O son of Kunti, that state he will attain, being always absorbed in such contemplation.

slokas: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च ।मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशय: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, at all times, remember Me and fight. With your mind and intellect dedicated to Me, you shall undoubtedly come to Me.

slokas: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना ।परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: With a mind engaged in the practice of yoga and not wandering elsewhere, one reaches the supreme divine person by meditating upon him, O Partha.

slokas: कविं पुराणमनुशासितार-मणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: ।सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप-मादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: The sage, the ancient one, the ruler, who is subtler than the subtle; the sustainer of all, of inconceivable form, of the color of the sun, beyond the darkness.

slokas: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेनभक्त्य‍ा युक्तो योगबलेन चैव ।भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्य-क्स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: At the time of departure, with a mind unwavering and filled with devotion, by the power of yoga, and fixing the life force between the eyebrows, one attains that supreme, divine Purusha.

slokas: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्तिविशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागा: ।यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्तितत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: The imperishable state which the knowers of the Vedas speak of, into which the ascetics, free from attachment, enter, and desiring which they practice celibacy, that goal I shall briefly describe to you.

slokas: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च ।मूध्‍न्‍‍र्याधायात्मन: प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Restraining all the gates of the body, confining the mind within the heart, and fixing the life-breath in the head, established in the practice of yoga.

slokas: ॐ इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् ।य: प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: The one who departs, uttering the single syllable "Om," which is Brahman, and remembering Me, leaves the body and attains the supreme goal.

slokas: अनन्यचेता: सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यश: ।तस्याहं सुलभ: पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिन: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: With an unwavering mind, he who constantly remembers Me, I am easily attainable for that ever steadfast yogi, O Partha.

slokas: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दु:खालयमशाश्वतम् ।नाप्‍नुवन्ति महात्मान: संसिद्धिं परमां गता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Having attained Me, the great souls do not undergo rebirth, which is the abode of sorrow and is impermanent; they have reached the highest perfection.

slokas: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्ल‍ोका: पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन ।मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: From the realm of Brahma downwards, all worlds are subject to return, O Arjuna. But having attained Me, O son of Kunti, there is no rebirth.

slokas: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदु: ।रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जना: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who know the day of Brahma, which lasts for a thousand yugas, and the night, which ends in a thousand yugas, are the knowers of day and night.

slokas: अव्यक्ताद्‍ व्यक्तय: सर्वा: प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: From the unmanifest, all manifest beings come forth at the arrival of day; at the arrival of night, they dissolve into that same unmanifest, which is called the unmanifest.

slokas: भूतग्राम: स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते ।रात्र्यागमेऽवश: पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: The multitude of beings, being born again and again, merges into the unmanifest at the coming of night, O Partha, and re-manifests at the coming of day.

slokas: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातन: ।य: स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Beyond this is another unmanifest, eternal existence, which does not perish even when all beings perish.

slokas: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहु: परमां गतिम् ।यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: The unmanifest is said to be the imperishable; they call it the supreme goal. Having attained it, they do not return; that is my supreme abode.

slokas: पुरुष: स पर: पार्थ भक्त्य‍ा लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।यस्यान्त:स्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: The supreme person, O Partha, is attainable by undivided devotion. All beings reside in Him, and He pervades all this.

slokas: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिन: ।प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: The time at which the yogis depart and do not return, and also the time at which they return, I shall declare to you, O best of the Bharatas.

slokas: अग्न‍िर्ज्योतिरह: शुक्ल‍ः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् ।तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जना: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Fire, light, day, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern solstice; those who depart during this time, the knowers of Brahman, go to Brahman.

slokas: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्ण: षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् ।तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Smoke, night, and the dark fortnight, and the six months of the southern path of the sun; attaining the lunar light, the yogi returns.

slokas: श‍ुक्ल‍कृष्णे गती ह्येते जगत: शाश्वते मते ।एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुन: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: The paths of light and darkness are considered eternal in the world. By one, one attains non-return, and by the other, one returns again.

slokas: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन ।तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: No yogi who knows these paths is ever deluded, O Arjuna. Therefore, be steadfast in yoga at all times.

slokas: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तप:सु चैवदानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् ।अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वायोगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: The merit that is declared in the Vedas, sacrifices, austerities, and charitable gifts—all this is surpassed by the yogi who, having known this, attains the supreme, primeval abode.
